result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.   CORRECTED 09-08-2015:  CFTS.  AMENDED 04-13-2016:  CFTS (credit granted is not duplicate to Waukesha County cases)
Consecutive to: time now serving

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with assessments, counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate by agent.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving

Defendant Jason W Johnson in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Jason W Johnson in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Preliminary hearing on August 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
